title: Energy white paper: Offshore wind, CCS and modernising data take centre stage
lead: ​The government’s energy white paper has today been published, detailing its decarbonisation plans across the entire economy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Piclo to take ‘next big step forward’ with £1.5m Clean Growth Fund investment
lead: ​The first investment from the government’s Clean Growth Fund has been secured by Piclo to help fund its UK and international growth.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Faster, fairer, greener: SWARCO eVolt’s Justin Meyer takes a look at the NIS and EVs
lead: What does the new National Infrastructure Strategy really mean for EV charging? SWARCO eVolt’s Justin Meyer takes a look at the key document.
author: Justin Meyer

title: BEIS to 'turn climate ambition into climate action' as energy white paper revealed
lead: The government’s energy white paper – designed to detail the government's concrete plans for decarbonisation – is today (14 December) to be released.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ENA sets out plan for networks to help ‘supercharge’ decarbonisation following Ten Point Plan
lead: ​The Energy Networks Association (ENA) has released its own Ten Point Plan, highlighting the role of networks in supporting offshore wind, electric vehicles (EV) and hydrogen.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Reactive Technologies hands construction contract for 'pioneering' 5MW ultracapacitor to Ingeteam
lead: ​Reactive Technologies has contracted Spanish technology group Ingeteam to construct a 5MW ultracapacitor to help National Grid ESO accurately measure inertia.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BP Pulse to rollout FreeWire’s battery-integrated EV charging in $50 million deal
lead: ​BP Pulse has signed an exclusive Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with FreeWire Technologies to deploy its Boost Charger at its UK operations.
author: Alice Grundy

title: E.On rolls out Smart Installation Services for suppliers
lead: ​Energy company E.On has launched a new service to help suppliers meet the UK government’s smart meter roll-out targets.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Current± Chats: GridBeyond’s Michael Phelan talks demand side response
lead: As 2020 comes to an end, Current± caught up with GridBeyond CEO Michael Phelan to discuss Dynamic Containment, flexibility and what’s next.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK council leaders push for net zero emissions by 2045
lead: ​A group of council leaders have committed to push for more government funding for clean energy projects in their local authorities.
author: Edith Hancock

title: RO shortfall sits at £33m with ten suppliers owing payments having gone under
lead: ​Ten energy suppliers that failed to meet the late payment deadline for Renewable Obligations (RO) have now either gone bust or had their licence revoked.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part one
lead: Part one of Current±'s annual predictions series is kicked off by Flexitricity's Alastair Martin and Arenko's Andy Hadland, offering their thoughts on what 2021 has in store for the energy transition.
author: Current± Staff

title: UKPN settles into new, energy efficient home
lead: ​UK Power Networks (UKPN) has moved into what it has dubbed its most energy efficient office ever.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF launches its cheapest EV tariff under GoElectric umbrella
lead: EDF has launched its cheapest electric vehicle (EV) tariff to date to help make it easier and cheaper for drivers to switch.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Centrica and unions take significant step in controversial contract negotiation
lead: ​A significant step has been made by Centrica and unions, with the majority of workers accepting new contract terms.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ‘Critical role’ of energy storage in future UK energy system detailed in 15-year roadmap
lead: ​A roadmap for energy storage has been launched by researchers at the University of Birmingham in an effort to detail its role in the energy system over the next 10-15 years.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy sector praises CCC 78% GHG reduction ambition, but calls for more details for next steps
lead: The CCC's landmark report has been broadly welcomed by the energy sector, who told Current± they commended the ambition but more concrete guidance is still needed for the sector.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Rapid charging lauded as public preference as Osprey unveils 100th EV charging site in Marstons rollout
lead: ​Osprey has completed the 100th rapid electric vehicle (EV) charging site as part of its deal with Marstons as the duo unveil new consumer research.
author: Alice Grundy

title: CCC releases ‘ambitious, realistic and affordable’ route to a fully decarbonised nation
lead: The Climate Change Committee (CCC) has laid out a route to a fully decarbonised UK, it what it is calling a world first.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica strikes deal with Alfen for EV charging infrastructure
lead: ​Centrica has signed a three-year framework with Alfen to supply electric vehicle (EV) chargers to British Gas engineers and Centrica sites.
author: Alice Grundy
